com.viaoa.jfc.editor.html.control

Class OAHTMLTextPaneController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.viaoa.jfc.text.OATextController
      • com.viaoa.jfc.editor.html.control.OAHTMLTextPaneController

  • public class OAHTMLTextPaneController
extends OATextController
    Expands on OATextController to create an HTML word processor. NOTE: this is now used internally by OAHTMLTextPane, and does not need to be create separately.
    • menuItems and buttons
    • dialogs for colors, editing source, search/replace, spell check, etc.
    • popup menu
    • printing
    • Inserting property paths for dynamic data, mail merges
    Author:
    vincevia

      • createImageHandler

        public void createImageHandler(Hub<?> hub,
                      java.lang.String byteArrayPropertyName,
                      java.lang.String sourceNamePropertyName,
                      java.lang.String idPropertyName)
        Parameters:
        hub - Hub that has all images in it.
        byteArrayPropertyName - name of property that is for a byte[] to store "raw"
        sourceNamePropertyName - property to use to store the source of the image (ex: file name)
        idPropertyName - unique property value to use for the html img src tag. If null, then sourceNamePropertyName will be used.
        See Also:
        Hub2ImageHandler

      • createImageHandler

      • setFieldClass

        public void setFieldClass(java.lang.Class c)
        Base/root class to use when inserting Field tags. Set to non-OAObject class to to have it disabled.

      • getFieldClass

        public java.lang.Class getFieldClass()
        Get the class to use for the list of Fields that a user can insert into a document. If fieldClass was not set by calling setFieldClass(..), then it will look for a method named "get"+propertyPath+"FieldClass" from the current Hub's class. If not found then it will use the Hub's class.
        Returns:

      • findElementUp

        public static javax.swing.text.Element findElementUp(java.lang.String name,
                                     javax.swing.text.Element start)
        find the first occurrence of an Element in the element tree above a given Element
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the Element to search for
        parent - the Element to start looking
        Returns:
        the found Element or null if none is found
